column2: C# provides a 'using' statement as a better alternative to manual resource disposal in a finally block - it makes sense to use it.
column4: This variable is manually [["disposed"|"relative:///CWE772_Missing_Release_of_Resource__db_Connection_01.cs:52:21:52:37"]] in a [["finally block"|"relative:///CWE772_Missing_Release_of_Resource__db_Connection_01.cs:44:13:66:13"]] - consider a C# using statement as a preferable resource management technique.

column2: Catching all exceptions with a generic catch clause may be overly broad, which can make errors harder to diagnose.
An assignment to a local variable that is not used later on, or whose value is always overwritten, has no effect.
column4: This assignment to [["intId"|"relative:///CWE772_Missing_Release_of_Resource__db_Connection_01.cs:25:21:25:25"]] is useless, since its value is never read.
